segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: And today we are covering a very important health issue.
segments.cn: 今天我们要讨论一个非常重要的健康问题。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We are... That's right.
segments.cn: 我们是...没错。

segments.en: In case of an emergency, maybe somebody stops breathing, so we need to apply CPR.
segments.cn: 在紧急情况下，如果有人停止呼吸，我们需要进行心肺复苏。

segments.en: Now what is this procedure?
segments.cn: 那这个程序是什么呢？

segments.en: Well, let's take a look at it in vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们在词汇预览中看看。

segments.en: CPR in English is an acronym that means C, P, and R all stand for different words.
segments.cn: CPR在英语中是一个首字母缩略词，C、P和R分别代表不同的词。

segments.en: The big phrase here is cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
segments.cn: 这里的大短语是心肺复苏。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So you don't have to remember that.
segments.cn: 所以你不必记住这个。

segments.en: Well, it's pretty hard.
segments.cn: 嗯，这很难。

segments.en: What if you break it down?
segments.cn: 如果你分解一下呢？

segments.en: So what is cardio?
segments.cn: 那么心脏是什么？

segments.en: Cardio means it has to do with your heart.
segments.cn: 心脏是指与心脏有关。

segments.en: And then pulmonary?
segments.cn: 那肺呢？

segments.en: Pulmonary means lungs.
segments.cn: 肺是指肺部。

segments.en: It has to do with your lungs.
segments.cn: 它与肺部有关。

segments.en: And what about resuscitation?
segments.cn: 复苏又是什么呢？

segments.en: That means to bring back.
segments.cn: 这意味着恢复。

segments.en: So to resuscitate is to bring back to life.
segments.cn: 所以复苏就是让生命恢复。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so this is a very popular procedure.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一种非常流行的程序。

segments.en: You probably see it in movies when, you know, somebody almost drowned the lifeguard performed CPR.
segments.cn: 你可能在电影中看到过，比如有人差点淹死，救生员进行心肺复苏。

segments.en: Oh, no.
segments.cn: 哦，不。

segments.en: The love of my life has just drowned.
segments.cn: 我生命中的挚爱刚刚淹死。

segments.en: And then someone comes and they push their chest.
segments.cn: 然后有人过来，按压他们的胸部。

segments.en: They say, one, two, three.
segments.cn: 他们说，一、二、三。

segments.en: They count.
segments.cn: 他们在数。

segments.en: And then the person spits out water and everything.
segments.cn: 然后那个人吐出水来，所有的一切。

segments.en: And they're like, I always loved you.
segments.cn: 他们说，我一直爱着你。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So that's CPR.
segments.cn: 所以这就是心肺复苏。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to this dialogue, see what's going on.
segments.cn: 我们来听听这个对话，看看发生了什么。

segments.en: And we'll be back shortly.
segments.cn: 我们很快就会回来。

segments.en: Hello, everyone.
segments.cn: 大家好。

segments.en: And welcome to our CPR for beginners course.
segments.cn: 欢迎来到我们的初学者心肺复苏课程。

segments.en: First of all, does anyone know what CPR stands for?
segments.cn: 首先，有人知道CPR代表什么吗？

segments.en: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
segments.cn: 心肺复苏。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We apply CPR in the case of cardiac arrest or pulmonary arrest.
segments.cn: 我们在心脏骤停或肺部骤停的情况下进行心肺复苏。

segments.en: What does that mean?
segments.cn: 这是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, basically, if your heart stops pumping blood or your lungs stop pumping air, then we need to get them going again.
segments.cn: 基本上，如果你的心脏停止泵血或你的肺停止泵气，那么我们需要让它们重新运作。

segments.en: That's when we have to apply this procedure.
segments.cn: 这就是我们需要进行这个程序的时候。

segments.en: Let's begin.
segments.cn: 让我们开始吧。

segments.en: I need a volunteer.
segments.cn: 我需要一个志愿者。

segments.en: Me, me.
segments.cn: 我，我。

segments.en: All right, come here and lay flat on your back.
segments.cn: 好吧，过来，平躺在背上。

segments.en: Let's suppose this young woman has stopped breathing.
segments.cn: 假设这个年轻女性停止了呼吸。

segments.en: We must lift the person's chin so that we clear a pathway for air to get into the lungs.
segments.cn: 我们必须抬起她的下巴，以便为空气进入肺部清理通道。

segments.en: Then we place our mouth over the other person's mouth and blow air two or three times like this.
segments.cn: 然后我们将嘴放在另一个人的嘴上，吹气两到三次，像这样。

segments.en: Wait, what are you doing?
segments.cn: 等等，你在做什么？

segments.en: I'm a married woman.
segments.cn: 我是已婚女性。

segments.en: You can't just try to kiss me like that.
segments.cn: 你不能就这样试图吻我。

segments.en: Ma'am, I'm not trying to kiss you.
segments.cn: 女士，我不是在试图吻你。

segments.en: I'm trying to demonstrate how to apply CPR in the case of an emergency.
segments.cn: 我是在演示如何在紧急情况下进行心肺复苏。

segments.en: Well, okay.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: No French kissing.
segments.cn: 不要法式接吻。

segments.en: As I was saying, we blow air through the mouth in this manner.
segments.cn: 正如我所说，我们以这种方式通过嘴吹气。

segments.en: Once this is done, we must try to get the heart going again.
segments.cn: 一旦完成，我们必须尝试让心脏重新跳动。

segments.en: To do this, we place our hands over the person's chest and press down firmly two or three times.
segments.cn: 为此，我们将手放在这个人的胸部上，向下用力按压两到三次。

segments.en: Wait, what are you doing?
segments.cn: 等等，你在做什么？

segments.en: You can't just kiss me then go for second base.
segments.cn: 你不能先吻我再去第二基地。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So a couple of pretty difficult words and phrases there.
segments.cn: 所以有几个相当困难的单词和短语。

segments.en: But don't worry, we'll explain them now in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 但别担心，我们现在会在语言总结中解释它们。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言总结。

segments.en: The first phrase we've got today is cardiac arrest.
segments.cn: 我们今天的第一个短语是心脏骤停。

segments.en: Alright, so cardiac arrest.
segments.cn: 好吧，心脏骤停。

segments.en: Now cardiac, I think that has to do with the heart again, right?
segments.cn: 现在心脏，我想这与心脏有关，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly, your heart.
segments.cn: 没错，你的心脏。

segments.en: And what about arrest?
segments.cn: 那么“骤停”呢？

segments.en: Well, arrest means two things.
segments.cn: 嗯，“骤停”有两个意思。

segments.en: Maybe you've heard of this meaning to arrest somebody, the police arrested someone.
segments.cn: 也许你听说过这个意思，逮捕某人，警察逮捕了某人。

segments.en: Well, this means to stop, okay?
segments.cn: 嗯，这意味着停止，好吗？

segments.en: So we're not talking about the police here.
segments.cn: 所以我们这里不是在谈论警察。

segments.en: We're talking about the heart stopping.
segments.cn: 我们在谈论心脏停止。

segments.en: So cardiac arrest means when your heart stops.
segments.cn: 所以心脏骤停意味着你的心脏停止了。

segments.en: Okay, and another word that's right next to it, pulmonary arrest.
segments.cn: 好的，另一个紧挨着的词是肺部骤停。

segments.en: So I'm guessing again, pulmonary has to do with lungs and arrest stops.
segments.cn: 所以我猜肺部又与肺有关，骤停是停止。

segments.en: So your lungs stop pumping air.
segments.cn: 所以你的肺停止了泵气。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So cardiac and pulmonary arrest, these are two times when your heart or your lungs, they stop doing what they are supposed to do.
segments.cn: 所以心脏和肺部骤停，这两种情况是你的心脏或肺停止了它们应该做的事情。

segments.en: Alright, and interestingly enough, the heart pumps blood, the lungs pump air, and that's our next word.
segments.cn: 好吧，有趣的是，心脏泵血，肺部泵气，这就是我们的下一个词。

segments.en: What is this word to pump?
segments.cn: 这个词是什么？泵。

segments.en: To pump means to fill something with, okay?
segments.cn: 泵意味着填充某物，好吗？

segments.en: So for example, the heart pumps blood to the rest of your body.
segments.cn: 例如，心脏将血液泵送到你身体的其他部分。

segments.en: That means it's always making sure your body has blood going into it.
segments.cn: 这意味着它始终确保你的身体有血液流入。

segments.en: And the same thing with your lungs.
segments.cn: 肺部也是如此。

segments.en: Your lungs help oxygen and air get to the rest of your body.
segments.cn: 你的肺帮助氧气和空气到达你身体的其他部分。

segments.en: So they pump it.
segments.cn: 所以它们在泵送。

segments.en: They fill up with air.
segments.cn: 它们充满空气。

segments.en: Okay, and we can do the same in other things.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们可以在其他事物中做同样的事情。

segments.en: For example, you pump air into your tire.
segments.cn: 例如，你给轮胎充气。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: If you have a flat tire, you're riding your bicycle and your bicycle won't move.
segments.cn: 如果你有一个漏气的轮胎，你骑自行车，自行车动不了。

segments.en: Oh no, you have to pump it with air.
segments.cn: 哦不，你必须给它充气。

segments.en: That means fill it up with air.
segments.cn: 这意味着给它充满空气。

segments.en: Okay, or maybe even pump water, right?
segments.cn: 好的，或者甚至可以抽水，对吧？

segments.en: Like in your house.
segments.cn: 就像在你家里一样。

segments.en: Or pump your car up with gas.
segments.cn: 或者给你的车加油。

segments.en: Okay, alright, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，好的，非常好。

segments.en: So now the man is going to explain how to perform this procedure, CPR, and he asks for a volunteer.
segments.cn: 现在这个人要解释如何进行这个程序，心肺复苏，并且他在找志愿者。

segments.en: Okay, a volunteer.
segments.cn: 好的，一个志愿者。

segments.en: This is a word that can be both a noun, so a thing, and it can be an action, a verb.
segments.cn: 这个词既可以是名词，也可以是动词。

segments.en: Okay, so who is or what is a volunteer?
segments.cn: 好的，谁是志愿者？

segments.en: A volunteer is someone who offers to do something for free.
segments.cn: 志愿者是自愿免费做某事的人。

segments.en: For free, without you asking them to do it.
segments.cn: 免费的，没让你要求他们去做。

segments.en: Right, so are there any volunteers in the room?
segments.cn: 对的，房间里有志愿者吗？

segments.en: Right, who wants to write this on the board?
segments.cn: 对，谁想在黑板上写这个？

segments.en: Me, me, me.
segments.cn: 我，我，我。

segments.en: Me, me, I do.
segments.cn: 我，我，我愿意。

segments.en: Okay, you can also volunteer to help people who need help.
segments.cn: 好的，你也可以自愿帮助需要帮助的人。

segments.en: So for example, in Haiti, there's an earthquake, and there are many people who offered to volunteer to help patients.
segments.cn: 比如，在海地，有地震，很多人自愿帮助病人。

segments.en: So that means they said, I will work for free to help these people.
segments.cn: 这意味着他们说，我会免费工作来帮助这些人。

segments.en: A volunteer.
segments.cn: 志愿者。

segments.en: A volunteer, or to volunteer.
segments.cn: 志愿者，或者自愿。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So now we have our volunteer, and the man is explaining what to do.
segments.cn: 现在我们有了志愿者，这个人正在解释该怎么做。

segments.en: Lift the person's chin so that we clear a pathway for air to get into the lungs.
segments.cn: 抬起这个人的下巴，以便为空气进入肺部清理通道。

segments.en: Oh, this is a good one.
segments.cn: 哦，这个很好。

segments.en: So a path is like a road.
segments.cn: 通道就像一条路。

segments.en: It's where something can go, can move.
segments.cn: 是某物可以走的地方。

segments.en: To clear a pathway means to make some room.
segments.cn: 清理通道意味着腾出一些空间。

segments.en: Okay, clear path.
segments.cn: 好的，清晰的通道。

segments.en: So that means, think about it, if you can't breathe, someone has to find a way to make room, to make a hole for you to breathe.
segments.cn: 这意味着，想想看，如果你不能呼吸，必须有人找到办法腾出空间，让你呼吸。

segments.en: So that means to move whatever is blocking you to clear some kind of space.
segments.cn: 这意味着移动任何阻碍你的东西，清理出某种空间。

segments.en: Okay, so that's a pathway, a clear space.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是通道，清晰的空间。

segments.en: And now, well, he's demonstrating how to perform CPR.
segments.cn: 现在，他正在演示如何进行心肺复苏。

segments.en: So what is this verb, to demonstrate?
segments.cn: 那么这个动词，演示是什么意思？

segments.en: To demonstrate is very important.
segments.cn: 演示是非常重要的。

segments.en: We use this in most kinds of teaching.
segments.cn: 我们在大多数教学中使用这个。

segments.en: So to demonstrate is to show or to give an example.
segments.cn: 演示就是展示或给出一个例子。

segments.en: Okay, so for example, here in EnglishPod, we are demonstrating how to use these words and sentences.
segments.cn: 好的，比如在EnglishPod，我们正在演示如何使用这些单词和句子。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So an example is a good way to demonstrate the word or the phrase.
segments.cn: 所以一个例子是演示这个词或短语的好方法。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to this dialogue again?
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍这个对话好吗？

segments.en: And we'll be back in a bit.
segments.cn: 我们稍后再回来。

segments.en: Cardiac arrest or pulmonary arrest.
segments.cn: 心脏骤停或肺部骤停。

segments.en: What does that mean?
segments.cn: 这是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, basically, if your heart stops pumping blood or your lungs stop pumping air, then we need to get them going again.
segments.cn: 基本上，如果你的心脏停止泵血，或者你的肺停止泵气，那么我们需要让它们重新运转。

segments.en: That's when we have to apply this procedure.
segments.cn: 这就是我们必须应用这个程序的时候。

segments.en: Let's begin.
segments.cn: 让我们开始。

segments.en: I need a volunteer.
segments.cn: 我需要一个志愿者。

segments.en: Me, me.
segments.cn: 我，我。

segments.en: All right, come here and lay flat on your back.
segments.cn: 好的，过来，平躺在背上。

segments.en: Let's suppose this young woman has stopped breathing.
segments.cn: 假设这个年轻女性停止了呼吸。

segments.en: We must lift the person's chin so that we clear a pathway for air to get into the lungs.
segments.cn: 我们必须抬起这个人的下巴，以便为空气进入肺部清理通道。

segments.en: Then we place our mouth over the other person's mouth and blow air two or three times like this.
segments.cn: 然后我们把嘴放在另一个人的嘴上，像这样吹气两到三次。

segments.en: Wait, what are you doing?
segments.cn: 等等，你在做什么？

segments.en: I'm a married woman.
segments.cn: 我是已婚女性。

segments.en: You can't just try to kiss me like that.
segments.cn: 你不能就这样试图吻我。

segments.en: Ma'am, I'm not trying to kiss you.
segments.cn: 女士，我不是在试图吻你。

segments.en: I'm trying to demonstrate how to apply CPR in the case of an emergency.
segments.cn: 我是在演示如何在紧急情况下进行心肺复苏。

segments.en: Well, okay.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: No French kissing.
segments.cn: 不要法式接吻。

segments.en: As I was saying, we blow air through the mouth in this manner.
segments.cn: 正如我所说，我们以这种方式通过嘴吹气。

segments.en: Once this is done, we must try to get the heart going again.
segments.cn: 一旦完成，我们必须尝试让心脏重新跳动。

segments.en: To do this, we place our hands over the person's chest and press down firmly two or three times.
segments.cn: 为此，我们把手放在这个人的胸部，向下用力按两到三次。

segments.en: Wait, what are you doing?
segments.cn: 等等，你在做什么？

segments.en: You can't just kiss me then go for second base.
segments.cn: 你不能先吻我再进一步。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's go with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们进行流利度训练。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利度训练。

segments.en: Well, the first phrase in Fluency Builder we hear in the beginning of today's dialogue, the teacher says, well, basically, if your heart stops pumping blood, then we need to get it going again.
segments.cn: 好吧，流利度训练中的第一句话是今天对话开始时，老师说，基本上，如果你的心脏停止泵血，那么我们需要让它重新运转。

segments.en: Okay, so that's a whole phrase there, to get something going, to get it going.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一整句话，让某物重新运转。

segments.en: What do you mean by this?
segments.cn: 这是什么意思？

segments.en: This means to start it up again.
segments.cn: 这意味着重新启动它。

segments.en: Okay, so we could say, I used to teach an English class for my colleagues, but we stopped having it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们可以说，我曾经为我的同事教英语课，但我们停止了。

segments.en: I'd like to get it going again.
segments.cn: 我想让它重新开始。

segments.en: Okay, so you'd like to start it up again.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你想重新启动它。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So usually you're talking about turning something on or getting something started.
segments.cn: 通常你是在谈论打开某物或启动某物。

segments.en: For example, maybe your car won't start.
segments.cn: 例如，也许你的车无法启动。

segments.en: So if you push it, you can get it going.
segments.cn: 所以如果你推它，你可以让它重新运转。

segments.en: Right, to get it going or to turn the keys to get it going.
segments.cn: 对，重新启动或转动钥匙让它重新运转。

segments.en: Okay, right.
segments.cn: 好的，没错。

segments.en: So to get something going.
segments.cn: 所以让某物重新运转。

segments.en: Now, moving on, we have two key phrases here that are a little bit spicy, right?
segments.cn: 现在，继续，我们有两个稍微有点火辣的关键短语，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, they're very romantic.
segments.cn: 是的，它们非常浪漫。

segments.en: Although this is a CPR class, so it shouldn't be very romantic.
segments.cn: 尽管这是一个心肺复苏课程，所以不应该太浪漫。

segments.en: All right, well, this phrase that we have coming up is French kiss, to French kiss someone or a French kiss.
segments.cn: 好吧，接下来这个短语是法式接吻，给某人法式接吻或法式接吻。

segments.en: So the volunteer says, okay, I'm happy to help you, but no French kissing.
segments.cn: 所以志愿者说，好吧，我很乐意帮助你，但不可以法式接吻。

segments.en: Okay, so what is French kissing?
segments.cn: 好的，那么法式接吻是什么？

segments.en: No one wants to answer.
segments.cn: 没有人想回答。

segments.en: All right, what is it?
segments.cn: 好吧，那是什么？

segments.en: Well, it is when you kiss someone, but your tongue goes into that other person's mouth.
segments.cn: 嗯，就是当你吻某人时，你的舌头进入另一个人的嘴里。

segments.en: All right, so there's a normal kiss.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以有一个正常的吻。

segments.en: You can kiss your friends on the cheek, but a French kiss means that you use your tongue.
segments.cn: 你可以在脸颊上吻你的朋友，但法式接吻意味着你使用舌头。

segments.en: Okay, so I wonder why they call it a French kiss.
segments.cn: 好的，我想知道为什么他们叫它法式接吻。

segments.en: Maybe Americans just were too shy.
segments.cn: 也许美国人太害羞了。

segments.en: They blamed it on the French.
segments.cn: 他们把责任推给了法国人。

segments.en: Maybe the French listeners out there can tell us.
segments.cn: 也许在场的法国听众可以告诉我们。

segments.en: All right, so now moving on.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在继续。

segments.en: And she says, okay, no French kissing.
segments.cn: 她说，好吧，不要法式接吻。

segments.en: Now the man is going to perform CPR, and obviously he has to firmly press down on her chest to get her heart pumping blood, right?
segments.cn: 现在这个人要进行心肺复苏，显然他必须用力按压她的胸部，让她的心脏泵血，对吧？

segments.en: Right, this is a part of CPR.
segments.cn: 对，这是心肺复苏的一部分。

segments.en: So first of all, you try to give the person air so they can breathe, and then you have to push their chest to start their heart.
segments.cn: 首先，你要给这个人提供空气，让他们能呼吸，然后你必须按压他们的胸部以启动他们的心脏。

segments.en: And this woman, the volunteer says, hey, what are you doing?
segments.cn: 这位志愿者说，嘿，你在做什么？

segments.en: You can't just kiss me first and then go for second base.
segments.cn: 你不能先吻我，然后再去第二垒。

segments.en: All right, so what is second base?
segments.cn: 好的，第二垒是什么？

segments.en: Okay, this is a sports metaphor.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一个体育隐喻。

segments.en: With baseball, right?
segments.cn: 是关于棒球，对吧？

segments.en: Baseball has four bases.
segments.cn: 棒球有四个垒。

segments.en: First, second, third base, and home plate.
segments.cn: 第一、第二、第三垒和本垒。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So in romance, when we're talking about dating, we have a way to say first, second, third, and fourth base.
segments.cn: 所以在浪漫中，当我们谈论约会时，我们有一种说法来表示第一、第二、第三和第四垒。

segments.en: First base is kissing.
segments.cn: 第一垒是接吻。

segments.en: So second base, what would be second base?
segments.cn: 那第二垒是什么呢？

segments.en: Well, in this example, it means touching.
segments.cn: 在这个例子中，它意味着触摸。

segments.en: Touching, certain parts of the body.
segments.cn: 触摸身体的某些部位。

segments.en: Romantic touching.
segments.cn: 浪漫的触摸。

segments.en: All right, so second base, and then obviously we have third and fourth, but we're not going to get into that now.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以第二垒，然后显然我们还有第三和第四，但我们现在不讨论这些。

segments.en: You can look it up on Google, third base and fourth base.
segments.cn: 你可以在谷歌上查一下，第三垒和第四垒。

segments.en: We trust that you can find it.
segments.cn: 我们相信你能找到。

segments.en: But first and second base are very common.
segments.cn: 但第一和第二垒是非常常见的。

segments.en: It's okay to talk about it.
segments.cn: 谈论它是可以的。

segments.en: It's not a bad word.
segments.cn: 这不是个坏词。

segments.en: So you'll probably see it in movies, young kids talking about first base or going to second base with someone.
segments.cn: 所以你可能会在电影中看到，年轻人谈论第一垒或和某人去第二垒。

segments.en: So it's kind of saying this in a different way, as a metaphor, as you said.
segments.cn: 所以这算是以不同的方式说这个，正如你所说的，作为隐喻。

segments.en: It's more polite than talking about it.
segments.cn: 这比直接谈论更礼貌。

segments.en: It's subtle.
segments.cn: 这很微妙。

segments.en: All right, so that's all the words and phrases we have on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们在流利度构建器上拥有的所有单词和短语。

segments.en: Let's listen to this great dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 让我们最后再听一次这个精彩的对话。

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to our CPR for beginners course.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到我们的初学者心肺复苏课程。

segments.en: First of all, does anyone know what CPR stands for?
segments.cn: 首先，有人知道CPR代表什么吗？

segments.en: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
segments.cn: 心肺复苏。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We apply CPR in the case of cardiac arrest or pulmonary arrest.
segments.cn: 我们在心脏骤停或肺部骤停的情况下应用CPR。

segments.en: What does that mean?
segments.cn: 那是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, basically, if your heart stops pumping blood or your lungs stop pumping air, then we need to get them going again.
segments.cn: 基本上，如果你的心脏停止泵血或你的肺停止泵气，那么我们需要让它们重新运作。

segments.en: That's when we have to apply this procedure.
segments.cn: 这就是我们必须应用这个程序的时候。

segments.en: Let's begin.
segments.cn: 让我们开始。

segments.en: I need a volunteer.
segments.cn: 我需要一个志愿者。

segments.en: Me!
segments.cn: 我！

segments.en: Me!
segments.cn: 我！

segments.en: All right, come here and lay flat on your back.
segments.cn: 好吧，过来，平躺在背上。

segments.en: Let's suppose this young woman has stopped breathing.
segments.cn: 假设这个年轻女性停止了呼吸。

segments.en: We must lift the person's chin so that we clear a pathway for air to get into the lungs.
segments.cn: 我们必须抬起这个人的下巴，以便为空气进入肺部清理通道。

segments.en: Then we place our mouth over the other person's mouth and blow air two or three times, like this.
segments.cn: 然后我们把嘴放在另一个人的嘴上，吹气两到三次，像这样。

segments.en: Wait, what are you doing?
segments.cn: 等等，你在做什么？

segments.en: I'm a married woman.
segments.cn: 我是已婚女性。

segments.en: You can't just try to kiss me like that.
segments.cn: 你不能就这样试图吻我。

segments.en: Ma'am, I'm not trying to kiss you.
segments.cn: 女士，我不是在试图吻你。

segments.en: I'm trying to demonstrate how to apply CPR in the case of an emergency.
segments.cn: 我是在演示如何在紧急情况下进行心肺复苏。

segments.en: Well, okay.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: No French kissing.
segments.cn: 不要法式接吻。

segments.en: As I was saying, we blow air through the mouth in this manner.
segments.cn: 正如我所说，我们以这种方式通过嘴吹气。

segments.en: Once this is done, we must try to get the heart going again.
segments.cn: 一旦完成，我们必须尝试让心脏重新跳动。

segments.en: To do this, we place our hands over the person's chest and press down firmly two or three times.
segments.cn: 为此，我们把手放在这个人的胸部上，按压两到三次。

segments.en: Wait, what are you doing?
segments.cn: 等等，你在做什么？

segments.en: You can't just kiss me, then go for second base.
segments.cn: 你不能先吻我，然后再去第二垒。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So a CPR class.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个心肺复苏课程。

segments.en: This is actually a very popular thing to take up.
segments.cn: 这实际上是一个非常受欢迎的课程。

segments.en: You never know when you need to perform it, right?
segments.cn: 你永远不知道什么时候需要进行它，对吧？

segments.en: That's true.
segments.cn: 这是真的。

segments.en: And I think it's a really smart class to take.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一个非常聪明的课程。

segments.en: You can usually take them for free at a community center or a fire department.
segments.cn: 你通常可以在社区中心或消防部门免费参加。

segments.en: The Red Cross.
segments.cn: 红十字会。

segments.en: The Red Cross.
segments.cn: 红十字会。

segments.en: I have a Red Cross certification.
segments.cn: 我有红十字会的认证。

segments.en: Oh, really?
segments.cn: 哦，真的吗？

segments.en: So you know how to perform this?
segments.cn: 所以你知道如何进行这个吗？

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: It's actually, as I said, I think it would be very useful.
segments.cn: 实际上，正如我所说，我认为这会非常有用。

segments.en: I've never taken a course like this up, but I know how to perform the procedure.
segments.cn: 我从未参加过这样的课程，但我知道如何进行这个程序。

segments.en: So I'm not certified, though.
segments.cn: 所以我没有认证。

segments.en: So I'm not a certified CPR person.
segments.cn: 所以我不是一个认证的心肺复苏人员。

segments.en: But it's interesting.
segments.cn: 但这很有趣。

segments.en: Let us know if in your country maybe you can take CPR classes or maybe you're a CPR certified technician.
segments.cn: 如果在你的国家你可以参加心肺复苏课程，或者你是心肺复苏认证的技术人员，请告诉我们。

segments.en: Or maybe you are trained in other ways.
segments.cn: 或者也许你以其他方式接受过培训。

segments.en: So we're curious about those as well.
segments.cn: 所以我们也对此很好奇。

segments.en: Let us know if you have any questions about today's lesson.
segments.cn: 如果你对今天的课程有任何问题，请告诉我们。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: All right, we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye, everyone.
segments.cn: 再见，大家。
